sec.p: We identified human population and poverty to be drivers of change in the hilsa fishery (see mmc1 in Supplementary material). Human population size influences the extent of fishing pressure in Bangladesh, because capture fisheries are essential for livelihood support and food security ( Belton et al., 2014; FAO, 2014). Human population size also influences the extent of development and infrastructure, including agriculture and aquaculture, which place pressure on hilsa habitat ( BOBLME, 2011). In hilsa fishing areas, low income is associated with fishing juvenile hilsa (known in Bangladesh as jatka) and with strong fishing dependence, which is characterised by illegal fishing and lack of other livelihood activities ( Bladon et al., 2018).
